thread.title: Spectacular footage of St Etienne fans setting off flares during Manchester United game at Old Trafford - Manchester Evening News
thread.title_full: Spectacular footage of St Etienne fans setting off flares during Manchester United game at Old Trafford - Manchester Evening News

author: Alexandra Rucki
title: Spectacular footage of St Etienne fans setting off flares during Manchester United game at Old Trafford - Manchester Evening News
text:
News Spectacular footage of St Etienne fans setting off flares during Manchester United game at Old Trafford Footage shows the stadium engulfed with red and green smoke after fans ignited the flares during Manchester United's Europa League game against French side St Etienne Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now St Etienne fans set off flares inside Old Trafford Share this video Get Manchester United FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
This is the moment raucous St Etienne fans set off flares at Old Trafford as Manchester United hosted the French side. 
Footage shows the stadium engulfed with red and green smoke after fans ignited the flares. 
The Ligue 1 side could now face a hefty punishment from Uefa, after at least one fan was seen launching a flare onto pitch. 
Despite the disruption, Greater Manchester Police last night said the game passed “without major incident” and only two people were arrested on Thursday night. 
Frustrated reds fans have blasted the security at Old Trafford and said it was lucky nobody was injured. 
Life-long Manchester United fan Keith Bradley, 53, of Worsley, said: “I am absolutely livid over what happened last night. Red and green flares were set off off by the St Etienne fans (Photo: PA) Read More Motorway slip road closed after corrosive acid spills from tanker on to road 
“There is heightened security at the moment at United. If you turn up you get searched at the door, you walk up to the turnstile, you get searched. 
“But then you see in the ground at least 20 to 30 flares going off last night. What really narked me is in this day and age the way things are going on, if anybody sees that and wants to do something at Old Trafford they might think it would be easier to get in something bigger than a flare. 
“There were so many kids and women there last night. How did all of those flares get into the stadium?” 
Sean Leeming, who attended the game, said: “It was incredible. I just can’t believe that every United fan got searched so thoroughly, yet they were able to get through the gates with dozens of flares and then set them off in the ground.”
